main event: On September 22, 1958, a civilian observer reported a sighting of a large white object with alternating red lights, larger than an aircraft, jumping back and forth, and very bright. The object emitted a sound like a jet and appeared to be stationary and moving slightly, then faded away after about 3 minutes of observation. The observation took place south of Oregon, Wisconsin.
interesting points: The object was described as white with alternating red lights, larger than an aircraft, and very bright.
The object emitted a sound similar to a jet and appeared to jump back and forth and remain stationary before fading away.
The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes, during which time the object remained visible and then disappeared.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting included cloudy skies with light rain and variable winds.
The report was made by a civilian observer, a 33-year-old housewife, south of Oregon, Wisconsin.
sighted object: large white object with alternating red lights
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
